page.title: 16TRANSPORT
page.content: {Grimoldby, Lincolnshire {Transport The bus service into Louth is a commuter based service. Many people use their own cars. Farm animals and produce are carried by large lorries which are too big for the narrow lanes The nearest railway station is at Market Rasen, 20miles to the East, over the Wolds, which in winter can be hazardous. The railway line from Grimsby to Kings Cross in London often entails a change at Newark, Notts. The nearest passenger port is Hull where a ferry goes to Rotterdam in Holland. There is a small airport at Kirmington which is mainly used by commercial concerns. It is cheaper for villagers to take a taxi from the village to London Airport than for them to motor down and park a car for a fortnight.
